URL: https://www.cnbc.com/2025/10/05/stock-market-today-live-updates.html
Title: S&P 500, Nasdaq close at fresh records to start week, helped by AMD gains
Description: The S&P 500 and the Nasdaq Composite rose on Monday as AMD shares surged on a partnership with OpenAI.
Publish Time: 2025-10-05T22:03:46+0000
Content: Mon, Oct 6 2025 4:10 PM EDT

S&P 500, Nasdaq notch closing highs
-----------------------------------

The S&P 500 and the Nasdaq Composite finished higher on Friday.

The broad market index rose 0.36% to end at 6,740.28, while the tech-heavy Nasdaq gained 0.71% to close at 22,941.67. That marks a fresh closing high for both indexes.

The Dow Jones Industrial Average, meanwhile, slid 63.31 points, or 0.14%, to close at 46,694.97.

_â€” Sean Conlon_

Mon, Oct 6 2025 3:57 PM EDT

AppLovin shares fall on report of SEC investigation into company's data-collection practices
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[AppLovin](https://www.cnbc.com/quotes/APP/)shares plummeted on Monday after[Bloomberg reported](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2025-10-06/applovin-has-been-probed-by-sec-over-data-collection-practices?srnd=homepage-americas)that the SEC has been probing the mobile advertising company over its data-collection practices. **Final Portfolio Composition (2025-10-06):**
- **NVDA**: 15 shares @ $185.50 = $2,782.50
- **MSFT**: 5 shares @ $518.61 = $2,593.05  
- **AMD**: 8 shares @ $226.445 = $1,811.56 (reduced from 10 shares)
- **AVGO**: 2 shares @ $335.92 = $671.84
- **ASML**: 2 shares @ $1,040.44 = $2,080.88
- **GOOGL**: 2 shares @ $244.78 = $489.56 (new position)
- **CSCO**: 1 share @ $68.435 = $68.44 (new position)
- **CASH**: $2.73

**Portfolio Rebalancing Actions:**
1. Sold 2 shares of AMD to take profits after the OpenAI partnership news drove prices up significantly
2. Bought 2 shares of GOOGL (Alphabet) for diversification and growth exposure
3. Bought 1 share of CSCO (Cisco) as a value play with remaining cash

**Result:**
- Reduced overweight AMD position from 21.6% to ~17.2% 
- Added diversification with GOOGL and CSCO
- Maintained core positions in quality semiconductor stocks (NVDA, MSFT, AVGO, ASML)
- Portfolio remains well-positioned for tech sector growth while reducing concentration risk
